reviews.review: fajna gierka tylko za dużo cheaterów i rusków

Hello, this is Teddy, the construction manager at the building site in Vertigo. My workers have had to put all construction at a standstill because of a russian gentleman calling himself 'Jame' hiding in one of the cranes with a long rifle. We've tried to get him down but he claims he is 'saving his A V P.' Does anyone know about this?

pro: naučíte se rusky

proti: ale sprostě

It's a fun, well put-together game. The mechanics work and are unique in the gaming world. Even with slightly outdated physics and graphics and some liberties taken with respect to the real world, the game has overtaken the gaming world (literally) and continues to do so.

However, this success does attract 'the scum of the virtual earth'. You have scores of trolls, cheaters and generally toxic people playing this game. It's a team game, and you WILL lose if you fail to play as such. But having team members scold you for not following their commands, for dying, for mis-throwing a grenade or not being able to 'clutch' (save) a round when you are the only one remaining, doesn't help (the game or your motivation). 

Then there is the rampant cheating going on. There is no shortage of wallhacks, aim hacks, spray control scripts, bunnyhopping... people will do anything to boost their ego and annoy others in the process. And Valve doesn't care all that much. They rely on self-monitoring, promoting people with experience to assess the issue for them (which is far cheaper than employing people to that purpose). I wouldn't mind paying a hefty sum to keep playing the game if that meant no more cheaters or trolls.
